revised_title: Benjamin Martin's Pursuit of Fellowship in the Royal Society
tldr: The article discusses Benjamin Martin's attempts to gain admission to the Royal Society in the 18th century. Martin, an itinerant lecturer and optician, believed that becoming a Fellow of the Society would enhance his reputation and career. He wrote letters to influential members, including Sir Hans Sloane and the Duke of Richmond, requesting their support. Despite his efforts, Martin was not successful in joining the Royal Society.
